item.name: Group
Admins

request.description:
# Returns a list of Admins within your specified Group

**Avilable fields**
`id,first_name,last_name,email,title,department,employee_number,primary_phone,primary_address,picture,link,locale,name,name_format,updated_time`


**Usage**

`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{group_id}}/admins?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Adds a Group Admin within your specified Group

**Avilable fields**
`uid`


**Usage**
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{group_id}}/admins
Body:
    uid: {{user_id}}
```

# Removes a Group Admin within your specified Group
_This does **not** delete the member from your community_

**Avilable fields**
`uid`


**Usage**
```
DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{group_id}}/admins
Body:
{
		uid: {{user_id}}
}
```

item.name: Events

request.description:
# Returns a list of Events within your specified Group

**Avilable fields**
`id,attending_count,can_guests_invite,category,cover,declined_count,description,end_time,event_times,guest_list_enabled,interested_count,is_canceled,is_draft,is_page_owned,maybe_count,name,noreply_count,owner,parent_group,place,start_time,timezone,type,updated_time`


**Usage**
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}/events?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Creates an Event within your specified Group

**Avilable fields**
`name,start_time,end_time,description,location`


**Usage**
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}/events
Body: 
		name: Name of event
		start_time: start time in ISO8601
		end_time: end time in ISO8601
		description: Your event description
		location: Your Location
```

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

_Note: Date format must be in ISO 8601 format, e.g.: 2019-02-28T08:00+00:00 represents 28th February 2018 at 08:00 am UTC+0_

# Deletes an Event within your community

**Usage**
`DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{event-id}}`

item.name: Feed

request.description:
# Returns the News Feed for your specified Group

**Avilable fields**
`id,admin_creator,application,caption,created_time,description,feed_targeting,from,icon,is_hidden,link,message,message_tags,name,object_id,parent_id,permalink_url,picture,place,privacy,properties,shares,source`


**Usage**
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}/feed?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Creates a Post within your specified Group

**Parameters**
* `message`: The main body of the post, otherwise called the status message. Either link or message must be supplied.
* `link`: The URL of a link to attach to the post. Either link or message must be supplied.
* `attachment_id`: Id of an attachment
* `attachment_url`: URL of an attachment


**Usage**
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}/feed
Body:
    message: "Text body of your post"
```

**Note:** To mention someone, use the following format in the `message`: `@[<user-id>]`, e.g. `@[10001234567890]`

item.name: Members

request.description:
# Returns a list of Members within your specified Group

**Avilable fields**
`id,first_name,last_name,email,title,department,employee_number,joined,primary_phone,primary_address,picture,link,locale,name,name_format,updated_time,admins,moderators`


**Usage**
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}/members?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Adds a user to the specified Group

**Avilable fields**
`member,email`


**Usage**
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}/members
Body:
    member: {{user_id}}
    OR
    email: "email@domain.com"
```  


_Note 1: Use `email` OR `member` when adding a user, do not use both_


_Note 2: When including email addresses in the URL for a request, ensure that the email addresses is URL encoded. Example: michael@example.com becomes michael%40example.com._

# Removes a Member your specified Group
_This does **not** delete the member from your community_

**Avilable fields**
`member,email`


**Usage**
```
DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}/members
Body:
		member: {{member-id}}
OR
		email: "email@domain.com"
```  


_Note 1: Use `email` OR `member` when adding a user, do not use both_


_Note 2: When including email addresses in the URL for a request, ensure that the email addresses is URL encoded. Example: michael@example.com becomes michael%40example.com._

item.name: Photos

request.description:
# Gets the picture details.

**Avilable fields**  
`id,name,from,height,width,created_time,album,can_delete,can_tag,icon,images,link,name_tags,place,target,updated_time`

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{photo-id}}?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.`

# Adds a Group photo

**Parameters**  
* `url`: Public URL of the photo
* `source`: Binary of file as a multi-part/form-data upload. 
* `message`: Message of your post.

**Usage**  
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}/photos
Body:
	url: "http://url-to-your-photo.com/photo.jpg"
```

**Note:** `url` or `source` is required.

# Deletes the picture.
Deleting user pictures is not supported.

**Parameters**  
- **[number]** `photo_id`

**Usage**  
`DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{photo-id}}`

request.description:
## Returns details of your specified Group

**Avilable fields**  
`id,name,description,is_workplace_default,is_community,privacy,updated_time,archived,post_requires_admin_approval,purpose,post_permissions,join_setting,cover,icon,owner,admins,moderators,members`


**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Creates a Workplace Group within your Community

**Avilable fields**
`name,cover_url,privacy,group_type,admin`

**Usage**
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/community/groups
Body:
    "name": "Group Name",    "name": string(any custom string),
    "archive": boolean{true/false},
    "privacy": string{OPEN/CLOSED/SECRET},
    "purpose": enum {WORK_FEEDBACK, WORK_ANNOUNCEMENT, WORK_SOCIAL, WORK_TEAMWORK, WORK_FOR_SALE, WORK_MULTI_COMPANY},
    "post_permissions": enum {NONE, ADMIN_ONLY},
    "post_requires_admin_approval": boolean{true/false},
```

_Note: Group admin requires an ID of an existing Workplace user within your community._

**Group Types**  
        WORK_TEAMWORK = Projects & Teams  
        WORK_FEEDBACK = Open Discussions  
        WORK_ANNOUNCEMENT = Announcements  
        WORK_SOCIAL = Social & More  
        WORK_MULTI_COMPANY = Multi-Company  
        WORK_FOR_SALE = Buy & Sell
		
_Note: privacy can't be set to OPEN to multi-company groups_

# Updates a Workplace Group within your Community

**Avilable fields**
`name,archive,cover_url,privacy,group_type,admin`

**Usage**
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{group_id}}
Body:
{
    "name": string(any custom string),
    "archive": boolean{true/false},
    "privacy": string{OPEN/CLOSED/SECRET},
    "purpose": enum {WORK_FEEDBACK, WORK_ANNOUNCEMENT, WORK_SOCIAL, WORK_TEAMWORK, WORK_FOR_SALE},
    "post_permissions": enum {NONE, ADMIN_ONLY},
    "post_requires_admin_approval": boolean{true/false},
	
}
```

item.name: Object Likes

request.description:
# Likes associated to an object  
This reference describes the /likes edge that is common to multiple Graph API nodes. The structure and operations are the same for each node.  
Returns an array of User or Page objects that liked the object, in addition to the optional field `total_count`. The following objects has a /likes edge:
* Album
* Comment
* Event
* Link
* Live Video
* Message
* Notes(Doc)
* Photo
* Post
* User
* Video 

**Parameters**  
* **[Bool]** `summary`: If `true`, includes the following fields: `total_count,can_like,has_liked`  

**Avilable fields**  
`id,name`  

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{object-id}}/likes?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Adds a like associated to an object  
This reference describes the /likes edge that is common to multiple Graph API nodes. The structure and operations are the same for each node.  
The following objects has a /likes edge:
* Album
* Comment
* Event
* Link
* Live Video
* Message
* Notes(Doc)
* Photo
* Post
* User
* Video 

**Usage**  
`POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{object-id}}/likes`

# Deletes a like associated to an object  
This reference describes the /likes edge that is common to multiple Graph API nodes. The structure and operations are the same for each node. The following objects has a /likes edge:
* Album
* Comment
* Event
* Link
* Live Video
* Message
* Notes(Doc)
* Photo
* Post
* User
* Video 

**Usage**  
`DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{object-id}}/likes`

item.description: # Likes on a Workplace object.

item.name: Object Comments

request.description:
# Comments associated to an object  
This reference describes the /comments edge that is common to multiple Graph API nodes. The structure and operations are the same for each node. The following objects has a /comments edge:
* Album
* Comment
* Event
* Link
* Live Video
* Message
* Notes(Doc)
* Photo
* Post
* User
* Video 


It is possible for comment objects to have a /comments edge, which is called 'comment replies'. The structure is the same for these, but attention should be paid to the modifiers for these edges.

For objects that have tens of thousands of comments, you may encounter limits while paging. The API will return an error when your app has reached the cursor limit.

**Parameters**  
* **[Bool]** `summary`: If `true`, includes the following fields: `order,total_count`  

**Avilable fields**  
`id,attachment,can_comment,can_remove,can_like,can_hide,can_reply_privately,comment_count,created_time,from,like_count,message,message_tags,object`  


**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{object-id}}/comments?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Comments associated to an object  
This reference describes the /comments edge that is common to multiple Graph API nodes. The structure and operations are the same for each node. The following objects has a /comments edge:
* Album
* Comment
* Event
* Link
* Live Video
* Message
* Notes(Doc)
* Photo
* Post
* User
* Video 


It is possible for comment objects to have a /comments edge, which is called 'comment replies'. The structure is the same for these, but attention should be paid to the modifiers for these edges.

For objects that have tens of thousands of comments, you may encounter limits while paging. The API will return an error when your app has reached the cursor limit.

**Parameters**  
* **[Bool]** `summary`: If `true`, includes the following fields: `order,total_count`  

**Avilable fields**  
`id,attachment,can_comment,can_remove,can_like,can_hide,can_reply_privately,comment_count,created_time,from,like_count,message,message_tags,object`  


**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{comment-id}}?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Adds a comment associated to an object  
This reference describes the /comments edge that is common to multiple Graph API nodes. The structure and operations are the same for each node.  
Returns an array of User or Page objects that liked the object, in addition to the optional field `total_count`. The following objects has a /comments edge:
* Album
* Comment
* Event
* Link
* Live Video
* Message
* Notes(Doc)
* Photo
* Post
* User
* Video 

**Parameters**  
* `message`: The comment text.
* `attachment_id`: An optional ID of a unpublished photo (see no\_story field in /{user-id}/photos) uploaded to Workplace to include as a photo comment. 
* `attachment_url`: The URL of an image to include as a photo comment. 
* `source`: A photo, encoded as form data, to use as a photo comment.
  
**Usage**  
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{object-id}}/comments
Body:
  message: "A post message"
  attachment_url: http://www.a-link-to-a-photo.com/photo.jpg
```  
**Note:** One of `attachment_url`, `attachment_id`, `message` or `source` must be provided when publishing.

# Deletes a comment associated to an object  
This reference describes the /comments edge that is common to multiple Graph API nodes. The structure and operations are the same for each node. The following objects has a /comments edge:
* Album
* Comment
* Event
* Link
* Live Video
* Message
* Notes(Doc)
* Photo
* Post
* User
* Video 

**Usage**  
`DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{comment-id}}`

item.description: # Comments on a Workplace object.

item.name: Object Reactions

request.description:
# Reactions associated to an object  
This reference describes the /reactions edge that is common to multiple Graph API nodes. The structure and operations are the same for each node.  
Returns an array of User or Page objects that reacted to the object, along with `summary`. The following objects has a /reactions edge:
* Album
* Comment
* Event
* Link
* Live Video
* Message
* Notes(Doc)
* Photo
* Post
* User
* Video 

**Parameters**  
* **[Bool]** `summary`: If `true`, includes the following fields: `total_count,viewer_reaction`  

**Avilable fields**  
`id,name,type`  

**since**  
`&since=UNIX_TIMESTAMP`

**until**  
`&until=UNIX_TIMESTAMP`

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{object-id}}/reactions?fields={fields}summary=true&since=1577836800&until=1593561600`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

item.description: # Reactions on a Workplace object.

item.name: Message

request.description:
# Get message for a given Message ID
Requires custom integration token with Read all messages permission 

**Avilable fields**
`message,from,to,created_time,id,tags`  

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{message-id}}?fields={fields}`  

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Get attachments for a given Message ID
Requires custom integration token with Read all messages permission 

**Avilable fields**
`id,nime_type,name,size,file_url`  

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{message-id}}/attachments?fields={fields}`  

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Get shared item details for a given Message ID
Requires custom integration token with Read all messages permission.
Gets details on shared items, including links, photos, videos, and stickers.

**Avilable fields**
`description,link,id,name`  

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{message-id}}/shares?fields={fields}`  

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Creates new named thread
To create a new thread with specific recipients, make a POST request to the /me/messages endpoint specifying an array of recipient IDs and an initial message payload.  
You'll get back a response payload that includes a thread ID, which you can use for follow-up messages.  
If you use the same endpoint with the same list of recipients again, a new thread will be created. To send follow-up messages to an already-created thread, make a POST request to the /me/messages endpoint using the thread_id in the recipient payload.  
**Parameters**  
* `recipient`: The User ID(s) of the participant(s)
* `message`: The message you wish to send.

  
**Usage**  
*To create a new thread*
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/me/messages
Body:
{
  "recipient": {
    "ids": [<user_ids>]
  },
  "message": <message_payload>
}
```   
*To use an existing thread*  
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/me/messages
Body:
{
  "recipient": {
    "thread_key": <thread id>
  },
  "message": <message_payload>
}
```  
**Note**  
For further information, see our documentation page [here](https://developers.workplace.com/docs/workplace/integrations/custom-integrations/bots#botsinchat)

item.name: Members

request.description:
# Returns a list of users within your Community

**Avilable fields**
`id,first_name,last_name,email,title,department,employee_number,primary_phone,primary_address,picture,link,locale,name,name_format,updated_time`


**Usage**
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/community/members?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Returns a list of users within your Community

**Avilable fields**
`id,first_name,last_name,email,title,department,employee_number,primary_phone,primary_address,picture,link,locale,name,name_format,updated_time`


**Usage**
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/community/former_members?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Adds a user to your Community

**Avilable fields**
`member 
or 
email`


**Usage**
`POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{community-id}}/members`

# Removes a member from your Community

**Avilable fields**
`member
or 
email`


**Usage**
`DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/community/members`

item.description:
# Edge: /{community-id}/members

The members of a Workplace community.

# Path /community
Represents your Workplace community. The `/community` node returns a single community object of type *Group*. For API convenience, you can think of the Community object as a root Group for the other groups in a Workplace community.

You can find your Community ID by making a Graph API `GET` call to `graph.workplace.com/community` with a custom integration access token.

item.name: Member

request.description:
# Returns list of Badges awarded to the user. 

**Avilable fields**

`id,name,description,icon,category`

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{user-id}}/badges?fields={fields}`  
Using email-address: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}/badges?fields={fields}`

# Awards a Badge to the user. 

**Avilable fields**

`id,name,description,icon,category`

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{member-id}/badges?badge={badge-id}`  
Using email-address: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}/badges?badge={badge-id}`


Custom badge-id are of format: `workplace_custom#123456789`

Default badge-id are of format: `workplace_champion`


_List of available badges can be obtained from `/community/badges` edge._

# Returns a list of users in your company

**Avilable fields**
`id,first_name,last_name,email,title,department,employee_number,primary_phone,primary_address,picture,link,locale,name,name_format,updated_time`

Deactivated user accounts can be shown instead by using the `inactive=1` URL parameter.

List company members based on external id of users using `external_ids=12356,abc123` URL parameter.

**Usage**
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/company/members?fields={fields}?inactive=1`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Returns a list of Deactivated users in your company

**Avilable fields**
`id,first_name,last_name,email,title,department,employee_number,primary_phone,primary_address,picture,link,locale,name,name_format,updated_time`


**Usage**
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/company/former_members?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

item.name: Conversations

request.description:
# A person or bot page's Workplace Messages. 
Requires either the Read all messages permission or an impersonate token for viewing a person's conversations.  
**Fields**  
`id,snippet,updated_time,message_count,unread_count,tags,participants,former_participants,senders,messages{message,attachments,from},can_reply,is_subscribed,link`  

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{member-id}}/conversations`
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}/conversations`

# Creates new named thread
To create a new thread with specific recipients, make a POST request to the /me/messages endpoint specifying an array of recipient IDs and an initial message payload.  
You'll get back a response payload that includes a thread ID, which you can use for follow-up messages.  
If you use the same endpoint with the same list of recipients again, a new thread will be created. To send follow-up messages to an already-created thread, make a POST request to the /me/messages endpoint using the thread_id in the recipient payload.  
**Parameters**  
* `recipient`: The User ID(s) of the participant(s)
* `message`: The message you wish to send.

  
**Usage**  
*To create a new thread*
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/me/messages
Body:
{
  "recipient": {
    "ids": [<user_ids>]
  },
  "message": <message_payload>
}
```   
*To use an existing thread*  
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/me/messages
Body:
{
  "recipient": {
    "thread_key": <thread id>
  },
  "message": <message_payload>
}
```  
**Note**  
For further information, see our documentation page [here](https://developers.workplace.com/docs/workplace/integrations/custom-integrations/bots#botsinchat)

item.description: A person or bot page's Workplace Messages. Requires either the Read all messages permission or an impersonate token for viewing a person's conversations.

request.description:
# Get a given member's timeline feed  
Events for this person. By default this does not include events the person has declined or not replied to.   
  
  
  
**Avilable Parameters**  
`include_canceled`: **[boolean]**: Whether include canceled events.  
`type`: **[enum: attending, created, declined, maybe, not_replied]**: Query events for which the user has this particular rsvp_status set


**Usage**  
Using member-id: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{member-id}}/events?{parameters}`  
Using email: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}/events?{parameters}`

Replace `{parameters}` with values required above, for example:  
`type=attending`  
`include_canceled=true&type=attending`

# Get a given member's feed  
The feed of posts (including status updates) and links published by this person, or by others on this person's profile. There are other edges which provide filtered versions of this edge:  

* `/{user-id}/posts` shows only the posts that were published by this person.  
* `/{user-id}/tagged` shows only the posts that this person was tagged in.  

All of these derivative edges share the exact same reading structure, however `/feed` should be used for all publishing purposes.

**Avilable fields**
`id,created_time,link,message,story`


**Usage**  
Using member-id: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{member_id}/feed?fields={fields}`  
Using email: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{email_address}/feed?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Updates a user as Frontline/Non-Frontline.

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{user-id}}`  
Using email-address: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}`  

```
BODY

{
  "is_frontline" : bool. true makes user as frontline.
}
```

# Get a given member's manager  
`/{member_id}/managers`  
`/{email_address}/managers`

**Avilable fields**
`id,first_name,last_name,email,title,department,employee_number,impersonate_token,primary_phone,primary_address,picture,link,locale,name,name_format,updated_time`


**Usage**  
Using member-id: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{member_id}/managers?fields={fields}`  
Using email: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{email_address}/managers?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

item.name: Picture

request.description:
# The member's profile picture
By default this edge will return a 302 redirect to the picture image. To get access to the data about the picture, please include redirect=false in your query.


**Parameters**  
- **[Bool]** `redirect`: If false, will return information about the picture. True will return the picture.


**Fields**  
`height,is_silhouette,width,url`  

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{member-id}}/picture?redirect={true/false}&fields={fields}`
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}/picture?redirect={true/false}&fields={fields}`
Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Creates member's profile picture

**Parameters**  
BODY:

- **[string]** `caption`
- **[url]** `image_url`

**Usage**  
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{member-id}}/profile_pictures
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}/profile_pictures
```

item.description: The member's profile pictures.

item.name: Reports

request.description:
# Get a given member's reports  
`/{member-id}/reports`  
`/{email-address}/reports`

**Avilable fields**
`id,first_name,last_name,email,title,department,employee_number,primary_phone,primary_address,picture,link,locale,name,name_format,updated_time`


**Usage**  
Using member-id: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{member-id}}/reports?fields={fields}`  
Using email: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}/reports?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

item.description: Edge: /{{member-id}}/reports

request.description:
# Adds a skill to the User. 

**Parameters**

`[string]name`: Name of the skill. eg: name=leadership

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{user-id}}?name={{skill-name}}`  
Using email-address: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}?name={{skill-name}}`

# Get list of skills of the User. 

**Parameters**

`name,id`

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{user-id}}/skills?fields={fields}`  
Using email-address: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}/skills?fields={fields}`

# Deletes a skill from the User. 

**Parameters**

`[string]name`: Name of the skill. eg: name=leadership

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{user-id}}?name={{skill-name}}`  
Using email-address: `DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}?name={{skill-name}}`

# Returns a single User object representing a Workplace user. 
Can be accessed via the member's Workplace ID or the email address used by the member when logging into Workplace.

`/{{member-id}}`  
`/}{email-address}}`

**Avilable fields**
`id,first_name,last_name,email,title,department,employee_number,primary_phone,primary_address,picture,link,locale,name,name_format,updated_time,account_invite_time,account_claim_time`


**Usage**  
Using member-id: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{member_id}}?fields={fields}`  
Using email: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{email_address}}?fields={fields}`  
Multiple ids or emails: `GET https://graph.workplace.com/?ids=person1@domain.com,person2@domain.com` Or   
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/?ids=101234567890,10987654321`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Returns Workplace ID of the user. 

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/company/accounts`  
```
BODY

{
  "name"         : string,
  "email"        : string,
  "title"        : string,
  "department"   : string,
  "organization" : string,
  "manager"      : <manager_id>,
  "division"     : string",
  "cost_center"  : string,
  "external_id"  : <employee_id>,
  "invited"      : bool,
  "work_locale"  : "en_US",
  "auth_method"  : "password"/"sso",
  "is_frontline" : bool
}
```
name: required
email or external_id: required .

# Returns Workplace ID of the user. 

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{user-id}}`  
Using email-address: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}`  
```
BODY

{
  "name"         : string,
  "email"        : string,
  "title"        : string,
  "department"   : string,
  "organization" : string,
  "manager"      : <manager_id>,
  "division"     : string",
  "cost_center"  : string,
  "external_id"  : <employee_id>,
  "invited"      : bool,
  "work_locale"  : "en_US",
  "auth_method"  : "password"/"sso",
  "is_frontline" : bool
}
```

# Set user as active/deactive. 

**Parameters**

`[bool]active: true to activate user, false to deactivate`

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{user-id}}?active=false`  
Using email-address: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}?active=false`

# Logout a user from all devices. 

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{user-id}}/logout`  
Using email-address: `POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}/logout`

# Returns Workplace ID of the user. 
Can only be used for **unclaimed** accounts.

**Usage**  
Using member-id: `DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{user-id}}`  
Using email-address: `DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{email-address}}`

item.description:
#Path /{{member-id}}

Represents a user object as a member of a Workplace community or group.

item.name: Photo

request.description:
# Gets details of photo with a given ID  

**Avilable fields**  
`id,name,from,height,width,created_time,album,can_delete,can_tag,icon,images,link,name_tags,place,target,updated_time`


**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{photo-id}}?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Posts a photo in the Group.

**Parameters**  
* `url`: Public URL of the photo
* `source`: Binary of file as a multi-part/form-data upload. 
* `message`: Message of your post.

**Usage**  
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}/photos
Body:
	url: "http://url-to-your-photo.com/photo.jpg"
	message: The main body of the post, otherwise called the status message.
```

**Note:** `url` or `source` is required.

# Deletes a photo.
Not supported for user photos.

**Usage**  
`DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{photo-id}}`

item.description: # Edge: `/{{photo-id}}`

item.name: Attachments

request.description:
# Media content associated with a post or comment. 
Attachments are accessed from the following endpoints:
  
* `/{{post-id}}/attachments` displays all attachments and sub attachments associated with a particular post.
* `/{{comment-id}}?fields=attachment` displays any media attachment associated with a comment.
  
**Avilable fields**  
`id,description,target,type`


**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{post-id}}/attachments?fields={fields}`

`{{post-id}}` complete post ID usually in the format "{{group_id}}_{{post_id}}"

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

item.description: # All media attachments associated with this post.

item.name: Seen By

request.description:
**To check the seen state for a group post**

This will return a list of the people who have seen the post. If you want a post count summary, use the summary field.  

**Fields**  
`id,name,seen_time`

**since**  
`&since=UNIX_TIMESTAMP`

**until**  
`&until=UNIX_TIMESTAMP`

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{post-id}}/seen?fields={fields}`  

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

item.description: To check the seen state for a group post, make a GET request to the /post_id/seen edge. This will return a list of the people who have seen the post. If you want a post count summary, use the summary field.

request.description:
# This edge represents any posts where the original object was shared on Workplace.

**Fields**  
`id,created_time,message,story`

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{post-id}}/sharedposts`

# Returns details about a given post id with a Poll
An individual post in any group.

**Avilable fields**
`id,created_time,from,question,updated_time`


**Usage**
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{post-id}}?fields=poll{options{{poll_options}}}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Returns details about a given post id  
An individual post in a group or user timeline.

**Avilable fields**
`id,admin_creator,actions,application,caption,created_time,description,feed_targeting,from,icon,is_hidden,link,message,message_tags,name,object_id,parent_id,permalink_url,picture,place,properties,shares,source`


**Usage**
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{post-id}}?fields={fields}`

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Creates a Post within your specified Group

**Parameters**
* `message`: The main body of the post, otherwise called the status message. Either link or message must be supplied.
* `link`: The URL of a link to attach to the post. Either link or message must be supplied.
* `attachment_id`: Id of an attachment
* `attachment_url`: URL of an attachment


**Usage**
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/{{group-id}}/feed
Body:
    message: "Text body of your post"
```

**Note:** To mention someone, use the following format in the `message`: `@[<user-id>]`, e.g. `@[10001234567890]`

# Deletes a given post.  

**Usage**
`DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/{{post-id}}`

# Get users with a given Skill ID. 

**Parameters**

name,id

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/{{skill-id}}/users?fields={fields}`

_Refer to /member/skills edge for adding/deleting skills for a user_

item.name: Thread

request.description:
# Get Threadname for a given Thread ID  
  
**Avilable fields**  
`id,name,link,updated_time,can_reply,participants`  

**Usage**  
```
GET https://graph.workplace.com/t_{{thread-id}}/?fields=
```  
**Note:** Note the need to prefix the thread\_id with `t_` in the edge path.

# Renames an existing thread  
  
**Parameters**  
* `name`: The name of the thread


**Usage**  
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/t_{{thread-id}}/threadname
Body:
  Name: "New thread name"
```  
**Note:** Note the need to prefix the thread\_id with `t_` in the edge path.

item.name: Participants

request.description:
# Get participants of an existing chat thread  
  
**Avilable fields**  
`id,name,link,updated_time,can_reply,participants`  

**Usage**  
```
GET https://graph.workplace.com/t_{{thread-id}}/?fields=
```  
**Note:** 
Note the need to prefix the thread\_id with `t_` in the edge path.

Bot should be member of the thread to get participants list.

# Add participants to thread
Adds participants to a chat thread. Bot must be member of the chat group to which a user is being added.  
**Parameters**  
* `to`: The User ID(s) of the participant(s)

**Usage**  
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/t_{{thread-id}}/participants
Body:
  to: [<user_ids>]
```  
**Note:** Note the need to prefix the thread\_id with `t_` in the edge path.

# Remove participants from threads
Removes the participants from a chat thread. The bot must be the admin of that chat group to perform this action.  
**Parameters**  
* `to`: The User ID(s) of the participant(s)

**Usage**  
```
DELETE https://graph.workplace.com/t_{{thread-id}}/participants
Body:
  to: [<user_ids>]
```  
**Note:** Note the need to prefix the thread\_id with `t_` in the edge path.

# Get Message IDs for messages sent by participants in a chat thread  
  
**Avilable fields**  
`id,messages.source(PARTICIPANTS)`  

**Usage**  
```
GET https://graph.workplace.com/t_{{thread-id}}/?fields={fields}
```  
**Note:** Note the need to prefix the thread\_id with `t_` in the edge path.

item.description: Add or remote participants to a thread

request.description:
# Get Thread details for a given Thread ID  
  
**Avilable fields**  
`id,name,link,updated_time,can_reply,participants,message,from`  

**Usage**  
```
GET https://graph.workplace.com/t_{{thread-id}}/?fields={fields}
```  
**Note:** Note the need to prefix the thread\_id with `t_` in the edge path.

# Creates new named thread
To create a new thread with specific recipients, make a POST request to the /me/messages endpoint specifying an array of recipient IDs and an initial message payload.  
You'll get back a response payload that includes a thread ID, which you can use for follow-up messages.  
If you use the same endpoint with the same list of recipients again, a new thread will be created. To send follow-up messages to an already-created thread, make a POST request to the /me/messages endpoint using the thread_id in the recipient payload.  
**Parameters**  
* `recipient`: The User ID(s) of the participant(s)
* `message`: The message you wish to send.

  
**Usage**  
*To create a new thread*
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/me/messages
Body:
{
  "recipient": {
    "ids": [<user_ids>]
  },
  "message": <message_payload>
}
```   
*To use an existing thread*  
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/me/messages
Body:
{
  "recipient": {
    "thread_key": <thread id>
  },
  "message": <message_payload>
}
```  
**Note**  
For further information, see our documentation page [here](https://developers.workplace.com/docs/workplace/integrations/custom-integrations/bots#botsinchat)

# Creates new named thread
To create a new thread with specific recipients, make a POST request to the /me/messages endpoint specifying an array of recipient IDs and an initial message payload.  
You'll get back a response payload that includes a thread ID, which you can use for follow-up messages.  
If you use the same endpoint with the same list of recipients again, a new thread will be created. To send follow-up messages to an already-created thread, make a POST request to the /me/messages endpoint using the thread_id in the recipient payload.  
**Parameters**  
* `recipient`: The User ID(s) of the participant(s)
* `message`: The message you wish to send.

  
**Usage**  
*To create a new thread*
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/me/messages
Body:
{
  "recipient": {
    "ids": [<user_ids>]
  },
  "message": <message_payload>
}
```   
*To use an existing thread*  
```
POST https://graph.workplace.com/me/messages
Body:
{
  "recipient": {
    "thread_key": t_<thread id>
  },
  "message": <message_payload>
}
```  
**Note**  
For further information, see our documentation page [here](https://developers.workplace.com/docs/workplace/integrations/custom-integrations/bots#botsinchat)

# Get Messages for a given thread ID
Requires custom integration token with Read all messages permission 

**Avilable fields**
`id,message,created_time,to,from,attachments,shares{link}`  

**Usage**  
`GET https://graph.workplace.com/t_{{thread-id}}/messages?fields={fields}`  

Replace `{fields}` with values required above, or remove for defaults.

# Get Messages sent by a user on a thread.


**Usage**  
```
GET https://graph.workplace.com/t_{{thread-id}}/messages?user={{user-id}}
```  
**Note:** Note the need to prefix the thread\_id with `t_` in the edge path.

# Get Message IDs for all messages sent in a chat thread  
It also inludes messages to notify any membership changes.

**Avilable fields**  
`messages`  

**Usage**  
```
GET https://graph.workplace.com/t_{{thread-id}}/?fields=
```  
**Note:** Note the need to prefix the thread\_id with `t_` in the edge path.

item.description: Messages for a given thread ID, for a given user
